name: combinatorial_sum
author: 吴思扬
complexity: O(m · (log N + d · log M) + d² · (log M)²)
summary: Given integers n, m, d, and M, compute the XOR of f(j) for j from 0 to m-1, where f(j) is the sum of binomial coefficients C(i*d, j) modulo M for i from 0 to n-1. The problem involves advanced number theory techniques including Lucas's Theorem, Chinese Remainder Theorem, formal power series, and polynomial division under modular arithmetic with composite moduli.
